Name: Ownership and Accountability Mapper
Purpose: Define clear ownership, decision rights, and accountability structure for the selected async-first collaboration model during the pilot, ensuring that every critical workflow (information flow, decision logging, escalation, and model adjustments) has an unambiguous responsible role and backup.
Deliverables: A role-responsibility map represented as a set of ownership constraints: for each key activity in the chosen async model (e.g., documenting decisions, maintaining async rituals, monitoring alignment gaps), a single accountable role, supporting roles, and explicit escalation paths; expressed as a dependency graph or RACI-style table with no unassigned or multiply-accountable nodes.
Strengths: Good at eliminating ownership ambiguity; ensures that every part of the async collaboration model has a clearly mapped responsible role; surfaces role conflicts and gaps before the pilot begins; aligns the model with existing org structure without redefining it wholesale.
Watch-out: Breaks when asked to define job descriptions, career paths, or performance review criteria; not suitable for team coaching or interpersonal dynamics; fails if used to choose between async models instead of mapping ownership for a chosen one; must avoid tooling selection, UX design, or policy wording beyond what is needed to state who owns what.
